bibl.title: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, October 8, 1928

div1.p: Frost writes Carter about references for the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, October 8, 1928
div1.opener:
Book
Bibliography
Frost
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
SCHOOL OF HYGIENE AND PUBLIC HEALTH
615 NORTH WOLFE STREET
DEPARTMENT OF EPIDEMIOLOGY
BALTIMORE, MD.
October 8, 1928.
Miss Laura A. Carter,
The Westmoreland Apts.,
2122 California St., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
My dear Miss Laura:
div1.p:
I was out of my office all day Friday and Satur-
day, hence only today got your message about returning
the two volumes of the New Orleans Medical and Surgical
Journal, which are being mailed to you toady. I had
intended to send them sooner and wish to apologise for
not having done so.

I am also sending you herewith all the cards which
I find in the files referring to du Tertre. Some of
them are certainly all right, while others seem to be
somewhat in doubt. When you return them would it be
practicable to send me du Tertre's work or at least the
first volume? If so, I should like to see it just to
familiarize myself a little with it.

I hope by the middle of this week to be able to
get back on the MS.
div1.closer:
With best regards,
Very truly yours, W.H. Frost. whf/f
encl.
